items.title: Leveraging tax credits and incentives for sustainability projects

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Randa Barsoum of PwC US highlights that energy-related tax incentives are only part of the sustainability tax picture. She emphasizes less obvious levers â€” such as state and local abatements, location-based incentives, and R&D tax credits tied to innovation â€” and urges leaders to view sustainability investments through a broader tax-value lens.
bullets: Energy incentives are well-known but not the only tax opportunity for sustainability.
State and local abatements can provide additional tax relief for sustainability projects.
Location-based incentives may influence siting and investment decisions.
R&D tax credits can apply to innovation efforts like reimagining packaging or processes.
Viewing sustainability investments broadly can unlock meaningful tax value.
takeaways: Evaluate state and local abatements as part of site selection and project planning to reduce costs.
Factor location-based incentives into siting decisions for grid or data center projects.
Consider whether innovation in processes or services qualifies for R&D tax credits.
Adopt a broad tax-value perspective on sustainability investments rather than focusing only on energy credits.

items.title: Bringing In $251K A Year With 3 Jobs In The Bay Area

ai.summary: Based on the available descriptionâ€¦ The video profiles Naseema McElroy, a 44-year-old labor and delivery nurse in Brentwood, California, who runs the personal finance brand Financially Intentional and documented her debt payoff journey. In 2015 she had nearly $1 million in debt, became debt-free by 2017, and the title notes she brings in $251K a year with three jobs in the Bay Area.

In 2015 she had nearly $1 million in debt and by 2017 was debt-free.

items.title: TTEC accelerates AI deployment and revenue streams with Google Cloud Consulting

ai.summary: Based on the available description, TTEC partnered with Google Cloud Consulting to rapidly prototype and deploy AI solutions that unlocked new revenue streams. Sreeni Alakappan says TTEC used GenAI and Google Cloud infrastructure to streamline operations, boost developer productivity, and compress their digital transformation timeline.

takeaways: Partnering with cloud consulting can shorten AI deployment timelines and speed time-to-value.
Robust cloud infrastructure is presented as a foundation for GenAI-driven operational improvements.
Improved developer productivity via cloud tools can support faster solution delivery.
AI initiatives can be positioned to create new revenue streams, not just cost or efficiency gains.
